meanings.definition: The quality or state of being due.
meanings.sent1: Her dueness in completing the task on time impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The dueness of the payment was clearly stated in the contract.
meanings.sent3: The cat's dueness in demanding treats at 3 AM always makes me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dueness of the sun rising every morning is a comforting routine.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's dueness in grading papers quickly helped the students learn efficiently.

meanings.definition: The state of being owed or payable.
meanings.sent1: The dueness of the debt weighed heavily on his mind.
meanings.sent2: She reminded him of the dueness of the rent by the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The dueness of the bill made him realize he needed to budget better.
meanings.sent4: The dueness of gratitude towards her parents was always in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The dueness of respect for elders is a value passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: The proper or appropriate time for something.
meanings.sent1: He arrived at the party with perfect dueness, just as the cake was being cut.
meanings.sent2: The dueness of his arrival at the meeting was crucial for the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The dueness of the rain during the picnic turned it into a spontaneous water fight.
meanings.sent4: The dueness of her laughter in the quiet library startled everyone.
meanings.sent5: The dueness of the train's arrival allowed him to catch it just in time.
